cards.name: Bulbasaur
cards.description:
While it is young, it uses the nutrients that are
stored in the seed on its back in order to grow.

cards.name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.effect: Take 2 {G} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to this Pokémon.

cards.description:
The more sunlight Ivysaur bathes in, the more
strength wells up within it, allowing the bud
on its back to grow larger.

cards.name: Venusaur

attacks.name: Poisonous Whip
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description:
A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower.
The fragrance becalms those engaged
in a battle.

cards.name: Mega Venusaur ex

attacks.name: Critical Bloom
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

cards.description:
In order to support its flower, which has grown
larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs
have become stronger.

cards.name: Spinarak
cards.description:
Although the poison from its fangs isn't that
strong, it's potent enough to weaken prey that
gets caught in its web.

cards.name: Ariados

abilities.name: Trap Territory
abilities.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 1 more.

cards.description:
It spews threads from its mouth to catch its
prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go
hunt aggressively.

cards.name: Sunkern
cards.description:
It is very weak. Its only means of defense is to
shake its leaves desperately at its attacker.

cards.name: Sunflora

attacks.name: Quick-Grow Beam
attacks.effect: If Quick-Grow Extract is in your discard pile, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.description:
Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always
looking in the direction of the sun.

cards.name: Burmy
cards.description:
If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes
the cloak with materials nearby.

cards.name: Mothim
cards.description:
It flutters around at night and steals honey from
the Combee hive.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.description:
From the time it is born, a flame burns at the tip
of its tail. Its life would end if the flame were to
go out.

cards.name: Charmeleon

abilities.name: Ignition
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, when you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may take a {R} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to your Active {R} Pokémon.

cards.description:
If it becomes agitated during battle, it spouts
intense flames, incinerating its surroundings.

cards.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Inferno Onrush
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description:
Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an
altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very
high temperatures.

cards.name: Mega Charizard Y ex

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.description:
Its bond with its Trainer is the source of
its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability
greater than that of a jet.

cards.name: Houndour

attacks.name: Roar
attacks.effect: Switch out your opponent's Active Pokémon to the Bench. (Your opponent chooses the new Active Pokémon.)

cards.description:
It uses different kinds of cries for communicating
with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

cards.name: Houndoom
cards.description:
Upon hearing its eerie howls, other Pokémon get
the shivers and head straight back to their nests.

cards.name: Squirtle
cards.description:
When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside
its shell and sprays water from its mouth.

cards.name: Wartortle

abilities.name: Shell Shield
abilities.effect: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks.

cards.description:
It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to
maintain its balance while swimming.

cards.name: Blastoise

attacks.name: Double Splash
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 2 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack also does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
The rocket cannons on its shell fire jets of water
capable of punching holes through thick steel.

cards.name: Mega Blastoise ex

attacks.name: Triple Bombardment
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack also does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
The cannon on its back is as powerful as a
tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to
withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.

cards.name: Basculin

attacks.name: Surprise Strike
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon moved from your Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.description:
Anglers love the fight this Pokémon puts up on
the hook. And there are always more to catch—
many people release them into lakes illicitly.

cards.name: Clauncher
cards.description:
Clauncher's claws will regrow if they fall off.
The meat inside the claws is edible, but it has a
distinct flavor that doesn't appeal to all tastes.

cards.name: Clawitzer

attacks.name: Aqua Shower
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.description:
The cannonballs of seawater that Clawitzer
launches from its claw are powerful enough to
punch through tanker hulls.

cards.name: Magnemite
cards.description:
The electromagnetic waves emitted by the units
at the sides of its head expel antigravity, which
allows it to float.

cards.name: Magneton

attacks.name: Spark
attacks.effect: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
Three Magnemite are linked by a strong magnetic
force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

cards.name: Magnezone

attacks.name: Mirror Shot
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, if the Defending Pokémon tries to use an attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack doesn't happen.

cards.description:
Exposure to a special magnetic field changed
Magneton's molecular structure, turning it into
Magnezone.

cards.name: Emolga
cards.description:
This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries.
Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much
food that it can't fly properly.

cards.name: Helioptile

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.description:
The sun powers this Pokémon's electricity
generation. Interruption of that process
stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.

cards.name: Heliolisk

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.effect: Discard all Energy from this Pokémon.

cards.description:
One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill
outspread is all it would take to produce enough
electricity to power a city.

cards.name: Misdreavus

attacks.name: Lead
attacks.effect: Put a random Supporter card from your deck into your hand.

cards.description:
It loves to bite and yank people's hair from
behind without warning, just to see their
shocked reactions.

cards.name: Mismagius

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.effect: Move all {P} Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
Its cries sound like incantations to torment the
foe. It appears where you least expect it.

cards.name: Solosis
cards.description:
Many say that the special liquid covering this
Pokémon's body would allow it to survive in
the vacuum of space.

cards.name: Duosion
cards.description:
Its brain has split into two, and the two
halves rarely think alike. Its actions are
utterly unpredictable.

cards.name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Infinite Increase
abilities.effect: This Pokémon gets +30 HP for each {P} Energy attached to it.

cards.description:
It's said that drinking the liquid surrounding
Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is
highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

cards.name: Spritzee

attacks.name: Sweet Scent
attacks.effect: Heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.description:
The scent its body gives off enraptures those
who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of
love for Spritzee.

cards.name: Aromatisse

attacks.name: Perfume Blast
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, attacks used by the Defending Pokémon cost 1 {C} more.

cards.description:
The scents Aromatisse can produce range from
sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells
that sap an opponent's will to fight.

cards.name: Xerneas

attacks.name: Geoburst
attacks.effect: This attack's damage is reduced by the amount of damage this Pokémon has on it.

cards.description:
When the horns on its head shine
in seven colors, it is said to be
sharing everlasting life.

cards.name: Onix

attacks.name: Dig
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from—and effects of—attacks done to this Pokémon.

cards.description:
It rapidly bores through the ground at 50 mph by
squirming and twisting its massive, rugged body.

cards.name: Makuhita
cards.description:
It toughens up by slamming into thick trees
over and over. It gains a sturdy body and
dauntless spirit.

cards.name: Hariyama
cards.description:
It stomps on the ground to build power.
It can send a 10-ton truck flying with a
straight-arm punch.

cards.name: Nosepass

attacks.name: Rising Lunge
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.description:
The magnet in Nosepass's nose provides an
unerring compass, making it an excellent
partner for Trainers going on a journey.

cards.name: Mega Lopunny ex

attacks.name: Rapid Smashers
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description:
It swings its ears like whips and strikes its
enemies with them. It has an intensely
combative disposition.

cards.name: Mienfoo
cards.description:
Though small, Mienfoo's temperament is fierce.
Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly
will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.

cards.name: Mienshao
cards.description:
Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this
Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into
tiny pieces.

cards.name: Grimer
cards.description:
Appears in filthy areas. It thrives by sucking up
polluted sludge that is pumped out of factories.

cards.name: Muk

attacks.name: Gunk Shot
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description:
They love to gather in smelly areas where sludge
accumulates, making the stench around
them worse.

cards.name: Purrloin

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.description:
Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable
behavior come away with stinging scratches from
its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.

cards.name: Liepard

attacks.name: Snatch and Flee
attacks.effect: Your opponent reveals a random card from their hand and shuffles it into their deck. Shuffle this Pokémon into your deck.

cards.description:
Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant
figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.description:
Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you
leave trash lying around, you could even find
one of these Pokémon living in your room.

cards.name: Garbodor

attacks.name: Acid Spray
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.description:
This Pokémon eats trash, which turns into poison
inside its body. The main component of the
poison depends on what sort of trash was eaten.

cards.name: Steelix

attacks.name: Metal Defender
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.description:
It is thought its body transformed as a result of
iron accumulating internally from swallowing soil.

cards.name: Mega Steelix ex

attacks.name: Adamantine Rolling
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes  damage from attacks and has no Weakness.

cards.description:
To protect itself from opponents' attacks, it uses
magnetism to control pieces of its hard outer
shell that have flaked off.

cards.name: Probopass

attacks.name: Metallic Turbo
attacks.effect: Take 2 {M} Energy from your Energy Zone and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
It exudes strong magnetism from all over.
It controls three small units called Mini-Noses.

cards.name: Genesect

attacks.name: Metal Blast
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each {M} Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.description:
This ancient bug Pokémon was altered by Team
Plasma. They upgraded the cannon on its back.

cards.name: Ditto

attacks.name: Copy a Friend
attacks.effect: Choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon's attacks, except any Pokémon ex, and use it as this attack. If this Pokémon doesn't have the necessary Energy to use that attack, this attack does nothing.

cards.description:
It can freely recombine its own cellular structure
to transform into other life-forms.

cards.name: Porygon

attacks.name: Stiffen
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

cards.description:
State-of-the-art technology was used to create
Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be
created via computer programming.

cards.name: Porygon2
cards.description:
This is a Porygon that was updated with special
data. Porygon2 develops itself by learning about
many different subjects all on its own.

cards.name: Porygon-Z

attacks.name: Cyberjack
attacks.effect: This attack does 20 more damage for each Trainer card in your opponent's deck.

cards.description:
Porygon-Z had a program installed to allow it to
move between dimensions, but the program also
caused instability in Porygon-Z's behavior.

cards.name: Starly

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.effect: Put 1 random Starly from your deck onto your Bench.

cards.description:
Because they are weak individually, they form
groups. However, they bicker if the group grows
too big.

cards.name: Staravia

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.description:
They maintain huge flocks, although fierce
scuffles break out between various flocks.

cards.name: Staraptor

attacks.name: Hurricane Wing
attacks.effect: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

cards.description:
It never stops attacking even if it is injured.
It fusses over the shape of its comb.

cards.name: Buneary

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.description:
Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and
then striking with the force created by unrolling
them. This attack becomes stronger with training.

cards.name: Lopunny

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 50 damage for each heads.

cards.description:
Once hot seasons are over, Lopunny's coat will
be replaced with fur that holds a lot of insulating
air in preparation for colder weather.

cards.name: Bouffalant

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.effect: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.description:
These Pokémon live in herds of about 20
individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will
lose the hair on their heads for some reason.

cards.name: Furfrou

abilities.name: Fur Coat
abilities.effect: This Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

cards.description:
Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer,
but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.

cards.name: Clemont's Backpack
cards.effect: During this turn, attacks used by your Magneton or Heliolisk do +20 damage to your opponent's Pokémon.

cards.name: Quick-Grow Extract
cards.effect: Choose 1 of your {G} Pokémon in play. Put a random {G} Pokémon from your deck that evolves from that Pokémon onto that Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.

cards.name: Clemont
cards.effect: Put 2 random cards from among Magneton, Heliolisk, and Clemont's Backpack from your deck into your hand.

cards.name: Serena
cards.effect: Put a random Mega Evolution Pokémon ex from your deck into your hand.

cards.name: Ariados

abilities.name: Trap Territory
abilities.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon's Retreat Cost is 1 more.

cards.description:
It spews threads from its mouth to catch its
prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go
hunt aggressively.

cards.name: Sunflora

attacks.name: Quick-Grow Beam
attacks.effect: If Quick-Grow Extract is in your discard pile, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.description:
Since it converts sunlight into energy, it is always
looking in the direction of the sun.

cards.name: Reuniclus

abilities.name: Infinite Increase
abilities.effect: This Pokémon gets +30 HP for each {P} Energy attached to it.

cards.description:
It's said that drinking the liquid surrounding
Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is
highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.

cards.name: Xerneas

attacks.name: Geoburst
attacks.effect: This attack's damage is reduced by the amount of damage this Pokémon has on it.

cards.description:
When the horns on its head shine
in seven colors, it is said to be
sharing everlasting life.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.description:
Its favorite places are unsanitary ones. If you
leave trash lying around, you could even find
one of these Pokémon living in your room.

cards.name: Buneary

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage for each heads.

cards.description:
Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and
then striking with the force created by unrolling
them. This attack becomes stronger with training.

cards.name: Mega Venusaur ex

attacks.name: Critical Bloom
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

cards.description:
In order to support its flower, which has grown
larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs
have become stronger.

cards.name: Mega Charizard Y ex

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.description:
Its bond with its Trainer is the source of
its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability
greater than that of a jet.

cards.name: Mega Blastoise ex

attacks.name: Triple Bombardment
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack also does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
The cannon on its back is as powerful as a
tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to
withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.

cards.name: Mega Lopunny ex

attacks.name: Rapid Smashers
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description:
It swings its ears like whips and strikes its
enemies with them. It has an intensely
combative disposition.

cards.name: Mega Steelix ex

attacks.name: Adamantine Rolling
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes  damage from attacks and has no Weakness.

cards.description:
To protect itself from opponents' attacks, it uses
magnetism to control pieces of its hard outer
shell that have flaked off.

cards.name: Clemont
cards.effect: Put 2 random cards from among Magneton, Heliolisk, and Clemont's Backpack from your deck into your hand.

cards.name: Serena
cards.effect: Put a random Mega Evolution Pokémon ex from your deck into your hand.

cards.name: Mega Venusaur ex

attacks.name: Critical Bloom
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned and Asleep.

cards.description:
In order to support its flower, which has grown
larger due to Mega Evolution, its back and legs
have become stronger.

cards.name: Mega Blastoise ex

attacks.name: Triple Bombardment
attacks.effect: If this Pokémon has at least 3 extra {W} Energy attached, this attack also does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

cards.description:
The cannon on its back is as powerful as a
tank gun. Its tough legs and back enable it to
withstand the recoil from firing the cannon.

cards.name: Mega Lopunny ex

attacks.name: Rapid Smashers
attacks.effect: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage for each heads. Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.description:
It swings its ears like whips and strikes its
enemies with them. It has an intensely
combative disposition.

cards.name: Mega Steelix ex

attacks.name: Adamantine Rolling
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes  damage from attacks and has no Weakness.

cards.description:
To protect itself from opponents' attacks, it uses
magnetism to control pieces of its hard outer
shell that have flaked off.

cards.name: Mega Charizard Y ex

attacks.name: Crimson Dive
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

cards.description:
Its bond with its Trainer is the source of
its power. It boasts speed and maneuverability
greater than that of a jet.

cards.name: Oddish

attacks.name: Poison Powder
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.description:
If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move.
It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

cards.name: Gloom
cards.description:
Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor.
The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance
of 1.25 miles.

cards.name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Soothing Scent
attacks.effect: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.description:
It has the world's largest petals. With every step,
the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

cards.name: Charizard

attacks.name: Inferno Onrush
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

cards.description:
Its wings can carry this Pokémon close to an
altitude of 4,600 feet. It blows out fire at very
high temperatures.

cards.name: Shellder
cards.description:
It is encased in a shell that is harder than diamond.
Inside, however, it is surprisingly tender.

cards.name: Cloyster

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.effect: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes −20 damage from attacks.

cards.description:
Cloyster that live in seas with harsh tidal currents
grow large, sharp spikes on their shells.

cards.name: Sandshrew
cards.description:
It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If
hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp
claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.

cards.name: Sandslash
cards.description:
It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws.
Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping
them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.

cards.name: Type: Null

attacks.name: Quick Blow
attacks.effect: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.description:
A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific
mission, it went berserk during an experiment,
so it was cryogenically frozen.

cards.name: Silvally

attacks.name: Brave Buddies
attacks.effect: If you played a Supporter card from your hand during this turn, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.description:
This is its form once it has awakened and
evolved. Freed from its heavy mask, its speed is
greatly increased.

attacks.name: Big Beat
attacks.effect: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Big Beat.

abilities.name: Psychic Connect
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, you may move all {P} Energy from 1 of your Benched {P} Pokémon to your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grindcore
attacks.effect: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard a random Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sol Breaker
attacks.effect: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Rising Road
abilities.effect: Once during your turn, if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch it with your Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Cursed Metal
abilities.effect: Attacks used by your {P} Pokémon and {M} Pokémon do +30 damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.description:
Once upon a time, a king with an Aegislash
reigned over the land. His Pokémon eventually
drained him of life, and his kingdom fell with him.

cards.name: Quick-Grow Extract
cards.effect: Choose 1 of your {G} Pokémon in play. Put a random {G} Pokémon from your deck that evolves from that Pokémon onto that Pokémon to evolve it. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
